text:
So the new edition of the Oxford English
Dictionary has been published and guess what

there are lots of new additions some
superb-bril-tastic words have been added

this time and as a way of
commemorating this, we are going to take
a look at some of them right now.
Around 1,000 new words have been added to the OED this time, but we are going to

look at some of the more curious ones in
no particular order,

oh and by the way some of these words
might be offensive to one or two viewers
but please don't shoot the messenger
I said don't shoot the messenger.
The first new word is 'fuhgeddaboudit'

A us colloquialism associated especially
with New York and New Jersey reflecting

an attempted regional pronunciation of
the phrase forget about it, used to

indicate that has suggested scenario is
unlikely or undesirable.
Wesminster bubble was first used in 1998. The term describes an insular community of

politicians journalists and civil
servants who appear to be out of touch

with the experiences of the wider
British public. Gender-fluid An adjective

denoting or relating to a person who
does not identify themselves as having a
fixed gender.

Moobs... British informal, deposits of
excess fat on a man's chest that

resemble a woman's breasts; boozing
overeating and more female hormones in

the environment have been blamed for
blokes sprouting moobs. Chefdom

A noun meaning the overall fact state or
positioning of becoming a chef. YOLLO
An acronym often used on social media and through SMS messaging it stands for

you only live once. A term that is used to
urge a person to pursue their dreams or

desires. Cheeseball An adjectives used
as an insult to describe someone or

something lacking taste style or
originality or the breaded and

deep-fried cheese appetizer served at
the start of a meal.
Oompa Loompa Humorous or derogatory a short person he slept on a bed that was
made for an Oompa Loompac he's an Oompa loompa compared to the rest of the

players. A person whose skin has an
orange appearance typically because they

are very suntanned. Pale girls look much
prettier than those overtanned Oompa Loompas.

Yogalates A mass now a fitness
routine that combines Pilates exercises

with the postures and breathing
techniques of yoga

Here's a word that did not make it into
the dictionary this time around but we

might see it next time. Ringxietyy This
is a noun, the phenomenon of seeming to

hear or sense a non-existent message or
call on your phone. Do you have ringxiety?

and of course let us not forget the
word made up by me a few weeks ago 'overdramatacise'

It is my special verb to
overstate something for dramatic effect,
or to instill fear into someone.

Sadly that new word of mine has not
appeared in the latest Oxford English
Dictionary, at least not this time.

Perhaps next time it will keep looking
out and listening out for those new

English words and I will see you all
again real soon.
This is Misterduncan in England saying ta ta for now.
